org.safs.selenium.util

Class DocumentClickCapture

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.safs.selenium.util.DocumentClickCapture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class DocumentClickCapture
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Used to intercept mouseup, mousedown, and click events at the DOM document level in order to allow clicks on the document that will NOT invoke the application's event handlers. For example, when a ProcessContainer tool wants to investigate element properties by selecting an element with a click.

    Usage: 

    
 DocumentClickCapture listener = new DocumentClickCapture();
 try{
     MouseEvent event = listener.waitForClick(timeout_in_seconds);
     // do stuff with event info
     // use again if desired
     event = listener.waitForClick(timeout_in_seconds);
     // do stuff with event info
 }catch(Exception x){
     // handle them here
 }

    The use CAN allow the application's event handlers to see the events if the alternate constructor is used setting the allowPropogation boolean to true:

    Usage: 

    
 DocumentClickCapture listener = new DocumentClickCapture(true);
 try{
     MouseEvent event = listener.waitForClick(timeout_in_seconds);
     // do stuff with event info
     // use again if desired
     event = listener.waitForClick(timeout_in_seconds);
     // do stuff with event info
 }catch(Exception x){
     // handle them here
 }

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_DELAY_WAIT_READY_LOOP
      in a loop, default delay time (in milliseconds) to sleep before trying to detect the click event-ready (event information has be retrieved from page by javascript) another time.
      static boolean DEFAULT_IGNORE_EVENT_INFORMATION
      true, will not retrieve event's information.

      After event-fired, default timeout (5000 milliseconds) before click event-ready (event information has be retrieved from page by javascript).

      static int timeoutBtwEvtFireAndReady
      Only eventFired is set to true, this field will take effect.
      after event-fired, in a loop, timeout (in milliseconds) before click event-ready (event information has be retrieved from page by javascript).

    • Constructor Detail

      • DocumentClickCapture

        public DocumentClickCapture()
        Default constructor. Capture mousedown, mouseup, and click event and DO NOT allow default operation or propagation of the event to the application.

      • DocumentClickCapture

        public DocumentClickCapture(boolean allowPropogation)
        Alternate constructor. Capture mousedown, mouseup, and click event trio. Set allowPropogation = true if we want the final "click" to be handled by the application normally.
        See Also:
        DocumentClickCapture()

      • DocumentClickCapture

        public DocumentClickCapture(boolean allowPropogation,
                    WebElement target)
        Alternate constructor. Capture mousedown, mouseup, and click event trio. Set allowPropogation = true if we want the final "click" to be handled by the application normally.
        The target is the receiver of the event. Only the event happens on the target, the attached listener
        will be trrigered; Set target to null, if user wants the window.document to be the event receiver.
        See Also:
        DocumentClickCapture(boolean)

      • startListening

        public void startListening()
                    throws SeleniumPlusException
        Inject the Document level event listeners if they are not already injected. Does nothing if the listeners are already injected.
        Parameters:
        secondsTimeout -
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException
        See Also:
        addEventListeners()

      • stopListening

        public void stopListening()
        Stop the pollingThread from listening and remove the listeners. Normally only called if waitForClick is going to be bypassed for some reason.

      • waitForClick

        public MouseEvent waitForClick(long secondsTimeout)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                               java.lang.InterruptedException,
                               SeleniumPlusException
        Parameters:
        secondsTimeout - -- timeout in seconds before throwing InterruptedException
        Returns:
        MouseEvent object with some or all of its fields filled in. Fields can be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if timeout has been reached.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if secondsTimeout is < 1.
        SeleniumPlusException - if we could not add or remove eventListeners in the browser.
        See Also:
        #startListening(long)

      • run

        public void run()
        Internal Runnable use only.

        This thread monitors the javascript event flag to be set indicating the event was fired. monitor loop can be stopped internally with setRunning(false). If the event is detected the onEventFired() method is invoked by this thread. This is a single-fire event. Once fired or stopped the monitor will exit and the remote EventListeners will be removed from the EventTarget.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

        public java.lang.String getListenerID()

        java.lang.String _removeEventListeners()
